subject: Re: [junit] HtmlUnit vs jWebUnit
msgSnippet: ... I have mostly used HtmlUnit, and I rather like it. It is easy to use HtmlUnit to test web pages, even without serving them from a web server, which I
messageBody:
srinivas muthyala wrote:
>
> Hi All,
> I am currently in the process of choosing a
> testing framework for testing our web application. I
> am inclined to use either HtmlUnit or jWebUnit, but
> not sure if one is better than the other.

I have mostly used HtmlUnit, and I rather like it. It is easy to use
HtmlUnit to test web pages, even without serving them from a web server,
which I really like.

jWebUnit has evolved in the past few years to look very similar to
HtmlUnit, so I'm not sure how much a difference there is between the two
any more.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
